H0.text: A bar graph best shows the elements that make up Earth's atmosphere, which can be listed as percentages or displayed graphically.

H1.text: A pie chart is the type of graph that best displays the percentages of the elements that make up Earth's atmosphere.

H2.text: A line graph best shows the percentage composition of the elements that make up Earth's atmosphere.

H3.text: A scatterplot is the type of graph that best shows the elements that make up Earth's atmosphere, which can be listed as percentages or displayed graphically.

A4.text: Bar charts, which do not need to have separate legends, and can display other values such as averages or targets at the same time.

A5.text: Pie charts have to rely on colors, textures or arrows so the reader can understand them, making them unsuitable for use with larger amounts of data.
